page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Peveril castle is the oldest building in Castleton first built in 1086.Only the Keep and Curtain walls remain.The next oldest is the church Nave and Norman arch.It also has a Sanctuary ,a Vestry and a Belfry.Westward is Odin Mine Crushing circle where lead was crushed.Nearby is Mam Torhill made of Shale and sandstone.It was eroded over the years.On top an Iron age hill fort.The four tourist caverns used to be mined for lead.You travel through by boat in speedwell cavern.People lived in Peak cavern and used to make ropes.Winnats pass has a 4.1 gradient.Cavedale to the south is said to be a collapsed cavern.There is Town ditch,Russet well and Windy Knoll Cave.
